definitions.definition: an instrument made of plastic or metal used for writing with ink (= coloured liquid for writing, etc.)
definitions.sensetop: in penfrom the pen of somebody

examples.text: a message written in red pen *(= using a red pen)*
a new book from the pen of *(= written by)* Zadie Smith
His pen was poised, ready to sign his name.
I grabbed a pen and began taking notes.
The President has yet to wield his veto pen to block a bill.

definitions.definition: a small piece of land surrounded by a fence in which farm animals are kept
a penalty (= a chance to score a goal without any defending players, except the goalkeeper, trying to stop it)
people who write books, poems, etc. have a greater effect on history and human affairs than soldiers and wars
to write or start to write something
a small mistake in something that you write or say

examples.text: Sorry, it was a slip of the pen—I meant to write ‘pheasants’, not ‘peasants’.

wordOrigin: noun sense 1 Middle English (originally denoting a feather with a sharpened quill): from Old French penne, from Latin penna ‘feather’ (in late Latin ‘pen’). noun sense 2 Old English penn, of unknown origin.
